page.title: 11TEENAGE LIFE - LITTLE WITLEY
page.content: { Weekends}generally start on Saturday, yet my Saturday begins like any other day. As a sixth former at the King's School, Worcester, I go to school by coach arriving in Worcester at 8.30 a.m.{School}finishes at 12.15 when I usually go into town with some friends to obtain nourishment. { Saturday afternoons}consist of either watching a school home rugby match or coming home with some friends. During the{evening}I get ready to go out into Worcester, where an average evening's entertainment involves going to the cinema, or drinking with a group of school friends. {Sundays}are often occupied in doing school work that should have been done on Saturday. In the evening I relax either watching television or listening to the radio. by Jacky Mills
